This mini expansion includes:
- 4 chicken building cards
- 4 crazy chicken tokens
- 1 rules card

Name: Lets Go Cadets!
Description:
In the year 2500 C.E. (more or less), humanity has become, let’s say,  slightly clumsier and dull with the passing of time. Now, overwhelmed by the last Znorg’s invasion, humans are desperately looking for cadets up to the task. That is why you are here: a group of  uncoordinated and undisciplined new recruits, yet committed with a selfless willingness to serve with enthusiasm and loyalty   to “The Last Hope” left for humanity. Will it be enough?

A cooperative game from 2 to 4 players in a 30 minutes match on which you should manage “The Last Hope” spaceship while getting ready for the final battle against the Znorgs. Coordination, organization and teamwork are pivotal in order to survive in the ship. Will you be able to coordinate the numerous logistic tasks? Such as managing inventories, storing and keeping your food or even cleaning the bathrooms. Will you be able to do it while the occasional Znorgs’ inconvenient shenanigans disrupt the ship?

The game takes place during 3 stages where players will coordinate, upgrade ship modules and strengthen the team to defeat the Znorg in the Final battle.

The players will choose their dice simultaneously behind their screen. They will take turns declaring the number of the dice they are going to play, but not its color nor on which mission they will put them on to play. When everyone but the captain have declared their dice, the captain will say Lets, Go, Cadets! at which point everyone will simultaneously place their dice on a mission trying to fulfill the color and sum requirements, while trying not to damage the ship.

If players make it through the battle against the Znorg without destroying 4 ship modules, congratulations! You have saved humanity.

This game was the winner in the Party Games category at the recent Game Jam Latam Creativa 2021.

Name: Asesino en Serie
Description:
Serial Killer - One of the players will become the assassin with an unassailable instinct that has been repressed until now. The assassin will convince one of us to become an accomplice in a terrifying scheme: to eliminate one by one, those who until now have been but friends. The Murderer and accomplice will have to go unnoticed in each crimes, hide their plans from their 
 prospect victims and proceed without leaving traces nor suspicions.
 Will the targets be able to stop the murders in time? overcome their cunning, deception, and trickery of criminal duo? or will the killer and his accomplice end up unpunished and indulge in their bloodlust?

Asesino en Serie is a subtlety role game with three different game modes in the same box:


    A deduction game for 2 to 4 players, with games lasting 10 to 20 minutes.


In this version each player will receive his role, and a hand of cards that he will have to declare face down, on 6 different columns that stand for 6 possible murders. Strategically they will be placing cards and activating destinies, which means revealing the cards of a column. If 2 or more bad intentions appear, it is considered a murder. If 3 murders are completed then Killer and accomplice wins the game. The murderer is caught when the detective appears at his destination, or both cards are in the same column.


    An occult role-playing game for 5 to 10 players, with games ranging from 30 to 45 minutes.


This version of the game is a mafia-style subtlety role-playing game. The murderer and accomplices will succeed if the third murder occurs. If the murderer is caught, tried or killed both accomplice and murderer will have lost the game.


     "Family size" version of the game for 6 to 12 players, designed to be  played in real time with games lasting from 1 to 15 days.


In this version of the game, each player receives a card then  leaves the scene with his role card in his pocket, wallet or wherever he prefers. The person with the killer card must choose an accomplice and kill one person per day by showing him the killer card. Interaction is done using the game's official medium, which is the "Serial Killer" mobile app. The way to win the game for the 3 other players is to accuse the killer or for the killer to kill at least half of the players.

Name: Ü40 Party Quiz
Description:
A quiz game for people 40 and over wanting to test their knowledge about trendy things from those times.

One player after the other is the quizmaster and asks a question from the card.
All other player are allowed to answer simultaneously.
Whoever answers five questions correctly first wins.
Families: Series: Das Ü Party- and Quizgames (Spiel&Spass)

Name: Instant Warfare: Military Battle
Description:
The tides of war have fallen across the earth. Politicized radicalism has reached a breaking point and each player must fight to survive!

Instant Warfare puts you and up to 7 other people directly into the chaos. Each player represents an opposing military force, intent on keeping their way of life. Only one will survive this final battle.

Players take turns trying to eliminate each others armies through dice rolling.  In games with 4 or more players, play politics by assigning each player a political alignment.

Beware the effect of policies in warfare, allegiances do not last forever and we are beyond the point of civil discussion. You never know who is planning what when politics enter Instant Warfare!

—description from the publisher

Name: Magick Circle
Description:
Roll the dice to move clockwise round the Magick circle!
Collect Magick & Mana to attack your opponents!
The Last Wizard Standing.. Wins!

Name: Endgame
Description:
Endgame is a Chess variant which starts with the game already in progress, more or less.

Before the game starts players secretly purchase pieces using points. There is a maximum number of pieces of each type, but this is not always the same as in the standard game (e.g. a player can purchase two queens). The cost per piece goes up as more of the same type are purchased.

Once the players have their pieces they take turns placing them on the board, but all pieces except the kings (which are placed last) are placed on randomly-determined squares.

Once the pieces have been placed play proceeds according to the usual rules.

Name: Fast Track
Description:
Fast Track is played with a standard deck of cards, fourteen of which are placed on the table to form the track and fourteen of which are dealt to the players (i.e. seven each) as the horses.

The players simultaneously try to arrange their hands in an order which will get them all the way around the track. A horse card matching a track card in rank moves four spaces, in suit two spaces, and in color just one space.

When a player thinks they can get around the track they announce this and their opponent checks their solution. After the first race players switch hands and play again. If the result is tied after this a third round is played with a new track.

Name: Sashimono
Description:
A Tactical Card Game set in Sengoku Period, Japan.

You lead a coalition of allied DaimyÅ and Samurai vying to obtain control of historic Japan. While your opponent commands an evenly matched army, they lack your selection of leadership and myriad tactics. Just as one drop in the ocean contributes to the tide, so too shall your Sashimono banners guide your army to ultimate victory!

Players assign Sashimono cards to a row or column in their 3x3 grid of Kumi cards. Based on what Kumi cards are present in that line, they may perform actions listed on the assigned Sashimono card. These actions include manipulating their own grid or starting a battle with an opponent's line of cards. The in-play Sashimono cards also have a puzzle-like scoring condition, and if met, will "Bow" (turn horizontally) into a "check" state. Your opponent then has their next turn to try to "Unbow" your scoring condition. A player wins immediately when they score 3 of their Sashimono cards.


     Historic era subject brought to life by 17th century art, names, banners, and dates.



     Use battle to defend your objectives or ruin your opponent's plans.



     Minimal components, maximum replay, with 34 different goals.

Name: Animism
Description:
In an uncharted land after a long ice age, players take on the role of one of four tribe leaders setting out to cultivate this mysterious land using the power of spirits. For the prosperity of your tribe, connect the altars left behind by ancient civilizations with pilgrimage routes and deepen your faith in spirits. But be careful of the rival tribes! They may get in your way while taking advantage of the paths you've already built!

Animism is a pen and paper game where you write on your sheet but also other players’ until the game ends.

During the game, each player simultaneously fills in a space on the sheet they receive, then passes it to the next player.
Players fill in the sheet they receive with polyominoes of his or her own color aiming to connect the altars scattered by creating a pilgrimage route. The resources (the power of spirits) needed to purchase polyominoes can be obtained by neighboring routes with other players, but at the same time, there is a risk that your route will be blocked.

Try to get the highest score by connecting many altars on your route while trying to be adjacent to other players' routes appropriately.

The winner is the player with the highest total score on all sheets.

Name: Hot Diggity Dog
Description:
You are a hot dog vendor in a brand new baseball stadium looking to make a name for yourself as you get out there and sell juicy ballpark hot dogs to the hungry crowd of baseball fans. Your manager has told you to get out there and 'SELL, SELL SELL!' as you take to the Grandstands to move as many hot dogs as you can to keep the crowd happy and in their seats.
In the game Hot Diggity Dog, 2 to 5 players grab their trusty hot dog supply box and hit the Grandstands, looking to turn their carefully selected inventory into fistfuls of cash. Moving quickly but strategically around the sections, they look for opportunities to turn dogs into dollars and make the most of the seven innings before the concessions begin to close down.

In every inning of the game, each player has 5 action points to take any combination of the actions listed below to increase their sales.  
With these points, they can:
- Fulfill a hot dog order (1 AP)
- Move to an adjacent (no diagonals) Grandstand section (1 AP)
- Hawk your hot dogs to the crowd, adding another order to the section you are in (1 AP)
- Play a 'Dog Eat Dog' card (1 AP)
- Return to the commissary and restock your supply box (2 AP)

An event is revealed from the Huge-0-Tron deck at the top of every inning, potentially altering the course of play for the next turn. Players must also be on their toes and watch for opportunities to capture extra points by fulfilling the combination showing on the top card of the Incentive deck.  There is also an optional player interaction deck, the Dog Eat Dog deck, which allows you to get hands on in thwarting the efforts of your fellow vendors while you seize crazy opportunities to better your own position.

Carefully choose your route through the Grandstands, manage your delicious inventory, and seize the best opportunities to turn dogs into dollars to claim the spot as 'Top Dog' by the time the last 'Out' is called!

Name: Black Stories: Ab in die Kiste!
Description:
black stories: Ab in die Kiste! begins where most other black stories end: after death. This edition is all about what happens after you kick the bucket. In these 50 pitch-black riddles, bizarre stories are gathered around interesting ways to celebrate your eternal rest. And the most chilling thing about these stories: they really happened that way. Adventurous, funny, sometimes quite illegal - and 100% true! To match this theme, the coffin-shaped cards of the "black stories: Ab in die Kiste!" come in a high-quality box in coffin look, which makes the puzzle stories look even scarier.

How to play:
The card set contains 50 tricky, pitch-black puzzle cards for teens and adults to solve by asking clever questions. Cracking black stories together with friends is the most fun. One player, the bidder, takes a card from the deck, reads the short story written on the front of the card. On the back of the card, the master finds the answer, which he of course keeps to himself. Now the guessing people have to "ask" themselves the solution to the story. The questions should be formulated in such a way that the master can answer "yes" or "no". A spooky and fun guessing game for small and large groups - can also be played digitally.

Name: Black Stories Junior: Magic Stories
Description:
The successful mystery series "black stories" is also available in the "scary-free" version - for families with children from 8 years old. Instead of dark and scary it gets colorful and funny at the "black stories Junior".

Black Stories Junior: Magic Stories contains enchanting riddles full of glittering secrets all about cotton candy-farting unicorns, heroic dragon slayers, or mixed-up potions. The players try to reconstruct the stories by asking, guessing and fiddling about.

Name: 红色记忆——党史学习专用教具 (Red Memory)
金色军号——军史主题文创桌游 (Golden Bugle)
墨色山河——新中国史主题文创桌游 (Ink Colored Mountains and Rivers)
Eleven: Unexpected Events Expansion
Description:
This expansion adds two new mechanics: Breaking News cards which trigger the keywords you can find on Player cards and the Reputation track, as well as 14 new Board Meeting cards.
 Breaking News
During Matchday read a Breaking News card with the press coverage of your match to see if any of your Players’ keywords are mentioned. This may trigger an unexpected consequence for your game with your match ending differently than you expected! 
All 36 Breaking News cards have unique outcomes making each gameplay different and adding an amazing thematic flavor to your experience. 
 New Board Meeting cards
Increase the replayability of your game with 14 new Board Meeting cards that you can add to the base game.
 Reputation track
New Breaking News and Board Meeting cards from this expansion influence the Reputation level of your club, which is marked on the new Reputation track. Depending on your Reputation level, your club will gain benefits or penalties in the upcoming Matches.

—description from the publisher

Name: Eleven: Stadium Expansion
Description:
Make your Stadium a cultural center for the whole city with 50 new cards and 24 new Infrastructure tiles.

Get new Sponsors, hire new Staff members and make your Stadium a cultural center for the whole city! Build new elements, run concerts and national team matches, and more!

The Stadium expansion adds 24 new custom shaped Stadium Infrastructure tiles and 50 cards including new Objective, Staff, Sponsor, and Board Meeting cards that are related to the Infrastructure tiles from this expansion.

—description from the publisher
